results.title: Balto
results.creator_credit: Simon Wells, Steve Hickner, Amblin Entertainment and Universal Pictures
results.brief_description: Based on a true story, Balto is part husky/part wolf looking for a place to belong. An outcast in Alaska, he has few true friends - Boris the Russian snow goose, polar bear cubs Muk and Luk and the beautiful husky Jenna. Balto becomes a hero when the small town of Nome is struck by a diptheria epidemic. A blizzard means that medicine for the children cannot be delivered unless a team of sled dogs can race 600 miles to bring it back. When the dogs become lost, Balto must come to the rescue. Features the voices of Kevin Bacon, Bridget Fonda, Bob Hoskins and Phil Collins.

results.title: Balinese surfer
results.creator_credit: Bill Leimbach, Tony Dutton and Survival Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the younger generation on the island of Bali have overcome the traditional Balinese fear of the sea to excel in the sport of surfing. Also explains the Balinese attitude to religion and how it is absorbed into every facet of their lives, especially their art and dancing.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bill Leimbach, Tony Dutton and Survival Films

results.title: Ballet mecanique (TEFC)
results.brief_description: The French cubist painter Fernand Leger collaborated with American photographer Dudley Murphy to produce a dynamic view of modern life in the 1920’s. Using a series of rapidly intercut contrasting images, the film reduces humans to mechanical objects, creating rhythms and patterns of expressive force.

group_works.title: Bahrain: The pearl of the Arabian Gulf
Tibet: the roof of the world

results.title: Tibet: the roof of the world
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
For many years, Tibet was a land shrouded in mystery, shadowed by the mighty Himalayas and closed to western travellers. This travelogue takes the viewer into the heart of Tibet and its people. From the wonderous Potola, once home to the Tibetan spirtual leader, the Dalai Lama, to the mountain herders and their yaks, to carpet factories where weavers work for months on elaborate designs, this is an incredible journey through a rugged landscape. The intensly spiritual nature of Tibetans and the incredibly beautiful monastaries and elaborate rituals which celebrate their faith are testimony to the country’s strong commitment to Buddhist principles.

results.title: Ballet in New Zealand
results.creator_credit: Robert Lapresle, Cyril Morton, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The standard of ballet in New Zealand is shown in excerpts from four works - ‘Napoli’, ‘Do-wack-a-do’, ‘Les Sylphides’, ‘Prismatic variations’. A good representative selection which shows competence, imagination and enthusiasm.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Robert Lapresle, Cyril Morton, Geoffrey Scott and New Zealand National Film Unit

results.title: Bahrain: The pearl of the Arabian Gulf
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Passport travellers’ guides”.
Bahrain, an island nation in the Arabian Gulf, was once the capital of the pearl trade and was the site of the first oil discovery in the Gulf States. This includes an interview with the Amir of the State of Bahrain.

results.title: Ballade Pour Un Voyou = Ballad for a Scoundrel
results.brief_description:
An ex-convict is recruited to deliver a suitcase whose contents are coveted by a variety of secret agents. When he runs off with the suitcase, the local police grab his girlfriend to ensure the safe delivery of the secret contents. The spies, police and free lance adventure seekers all go after the man and his coveted package. He must decide whether or not to blow up the contents when faced with a showdown with the authorities.

Credits: Producer, Jean Thuillier ; director, Jean-Claude Bonnardot ; writers, Jean-Claude Bonnardot, Jacqueline Sundstrom, Alexandre Tabor ; photography, Jean Badal ; music, Samson Francois.
Cast: Laurent Terzieff, Hildergarde Neff, Philippe Noiret, Michel Vitold, Daniel Emilfork, Etienne Bierry.

results.title: Ballad to Crowfoot
results.creator_credit: Willie Dunn, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An impressionistic, haunting, often bitter account of the opening of the Canadian west, presented through still photography and the words and music of Willie Dunn, a Micmac from Montreal.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Willie Dunn, Barrie Howells and National Film Board of Canada
